results.title: Metformin Is Associated with the Inhibition of Renal Artery AT1R/ET-1/iNOS Axis in a Rat Model of Diabetic Nephropathy with Suppression of Inflammation and Oxidative Stress and Kidney Injury
results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@Diabetes@@@ significantly (p < 0.0001) modulated renal artery tissue levels of @GENE_AGTR1A @GENE_24180 @@@AT1R@@@, @GENE_EDN1 @GENE_24323 @@@ET-1@@@, @GENE_NOS2 @GENE_24599 @@@inducible nitric oxide synthase@@@ (@GENE_NOS2 @GENE_24599 @@@iNOS@@@), @GENE_NOS3 @GENE_24600 @@@endothelial NOS@@@ (@GENE_NOS3 @GENE_24600 @@@eNOS@@@), and the @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Disorders_Circadian_Rhythm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020178 @@@advanced glycation@@@ end products that were protected by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@.

citations.NLM: Dawood AF, Maarouf A, Alzamil NM, Momenah MA, Shati AA, Bayoumy NM, Kamar SS, Haidara MA, ShamsEldeen AM, Yassin HZ, Hewett PW, Al-Ani B. Metformin Is Associated with the Inhibition of Renal Artery AT1R/ET-1/iNOS Axis in a Rat Model of Diabetic Nephropathy with Suppression of Inflammation and Oxidative Stress and Kidney Injury Biomedicines. 2022 Jul 8;10(7):. PMID: 35884947

results.title: N-Terminal 2,3-diaminopropionic acid (Dap) peptides as efficient methylglyoxal scavengers to inhibit advanced glycation endproduct (AGE) formation.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Pyruvaldehyde @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011765 @@@MG@@@ scavenging potency of the newly synthesized N-terminal Dap peptides is demonstrated by RP-HPLC, @CHEMICAL_Sodium_Dodecyl_Sulfate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D012967 @@@SDS@@@-PAGE and non-denaturing PAGE analysis, assays for enzymatic activity and cell viability study and was compared with that of known @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Disorders_Circadian_Rhythm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020178 @@@AGE@@@ inhibitors, such as @CHEMICAL_pimagedine @CHEMICAL_MESH:C004479 @@@aminoguanidine@@@, @CHEMICAL_Pyridoxamine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011733 @@@pyridoxamine@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and carnosine.

citations.NLM: Sasaki NA, Garcia-Alvarez MC, Wang Q, Ermolenko L, Franck G, Nhiri N, Martin MT, Audic N, Potier P. N-Terminal 2,3-diaminopropionic acid (Dap) peptides as efficient methylglyoxal scavengers to inhibit advanced glycation endproduct (AGE) formation. Bioorg Med Chem. 2009 Mar 15;17(6):2310-20. PMID: 19261478

results.title: Effect of metformin on advanced glycation endproduct formation and peripheral nerve function in streptozotocin-induced diabetic rats.
results.text_hl: Effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @<m>DISEASE_Sleep_Disorders_Circadian_Rhythm</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020178 @@@advanced glycation endproduct@@@ formation and peripheral nerve function in @CHEMICAL_Streptozocin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013311 @@@streptozotocin@@@-induced @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.
